intro: Phaca lenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Phaca lenophylla is a hardy plant that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
